main event: A cylindrical object was observed in Crestone, Colorado, over several days in August 1956.
interesting points: The object was shaped like an elliptic cylinder and approximately 30 feet long., It was observed for about 59 minutes before being lost to clouds., On August 23, the object was sighted again for 1 hour and 30 minutes., The object was visible again on August 30 for 1 hour and 30 minutes before disappearing., The sighting involved ground radar and was noted as insufficient data for evaluation.
